section.title: What is an automated deployment?
section.para: As an addition to the interactive deployment described in , &alp-installer; supports an unattended automated deployment.

section.title: How does an automated deployment work?
section.para: &alp-installer; supports the following types of unattended deployment:

listitem.para: This type of deployment uses a customized file called profile that includes a description of the system to install.
This type of deployment uses a plain shell script that enables custom pre-deployment workflows.

listitem.para: Assumes that the profile is just a JSON file with no dynamic content.
Is interpreted as a shell script.
You can prepare the deployment setup in advance and modify it easily for future deployments.
By running an unattended deployment, you can save the time that you would normally spend in the interactive deployment process.
After fine-tuning the deployment profile, you can deploy multiple hosts at the same time to meet datacenter requirements.
